member.name: M:socket4net.Rand.Next(System.Int32[])
member.summary:
在总长为Sum(input)的线段中随机一个点 返回随机点所在的区间索引
例如： Next(1, 3, 6) 长度为10的线段，以1/3/6为长度连续划分为3段，亦即[0,1),[1,4),[4,10) 若Next(10)=5，此时5落在第3段，所以返回2 若Next(10)=1, 则返回0 若Next(10)=2, 则返回1 等...

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.CanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could be null sometimes, so the check for null is necessary before its usage

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could never be null

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form

member.name: M:socket4net.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.InvokerParameterNameAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function argument should be string literal and match one of the parameters of the caller function. For example, ReSharper annotates the parameter of

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally.
canbenull annotation is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("s:null=>false; =>true,result:notnull; =>false, result:null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked element should be localized or not

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators and Equals() should be used instead. However, using '==' or '!=' for comparison with null is always permitted.

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute
member.summary: When applied to a target attribute, specifies a requirement for any type marked with the target attribute to implement or inherit specific type or types.

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:socket4net.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used

member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member

member.name: F:socket4net.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature

member.name: F:socket4net.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type

member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used

member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.PureAttribute

member.name: T:socket4net.Annotations.PathReferenceAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a parameter is a path to a file or a folder within a web project. Path can be relative or absolute, starting from web root (~)

member.name: M:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.Enqueue(socket4net.IJob)
member.summary: External(e.g. the TCP socket thread) call this method to push a work item into the working queue. The work item must not be null.
member.param: the work item object, must not be null

member.name: M:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.Enqueue``1(System.Action{``0},``0)
member.summary: External(e.g. the TCP socket thread) call this method to push a work item into the working queue.
member.param: additional parameter that passed to working procedure

member.name: E:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.Idle
member.summary:
Idle event, call by working thread every period.
generally the working thread call the event every period, but if it's too busy because the working item consumes too much time, the calling period may grater than the original period

member.name: P:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.QueueCapacity
member.summary:
Specify the capacity of the working item queue.
when the items count in working queue reach the capacity of the queue, all producer will block until there is one or more slot being free

member.name: P:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.Period
member.summary: Specify the working period of the working thread in milliseconds. That is, every period,the working thread loop back to the working procedure's top. and, the Idle event is called.

member.name: P:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.WiElapsed
member.summary: A time counter that count the work items consume how much time in one working thread's loop. It maybe grater than the working period, which indicates the work items consume too much time.

member.name: P:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.IdleCallbackElapsed
member.summary: A time counter that count the Idle event callbacks consume how much time in one working thread's loop. This value should be less than period.

member.name: P:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.Jobs
member.summary: Specify the work items count currently in working queue.

member.name: P:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.ExcutedJobsPerSec
member.summary: 性能指标 每秒执行的Job

member.name: P:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.Capacity
member.summary: Job队列容量 由上层指定

member.name: P:socket4net.LogicServiceBase.ElapsedMilliseconds
member.summary: Get the elapsed milliseconds since the instance been constructed

member.name: M:socket4net.AutoLogicService.Enqueue(socket4net.IJob)
member.summary: External(e.g. the TCP socket thread) call this method to push a work item into the working queue. The work item must not be null.
member.param: the work item object, must not be null

member.name: P:socket4net.AutoLogicService.Jobs
member.summary: Specify the work items count currently in working queue.

the period of this timer, , in milliseconds. zero means the timer is schedule once only

member.param: when to begin this timer, in milliseconds. zero means start immediately

member.summary: When to start the timer, in milliseconds.

member.name: P:socket4net.Timer.IsPeriod
member.summary: Indicate it's a period timer or not.

member.name: P:socket4net.Timer.IsStarted
member.summary: Indicate whether the timer is start or not.

member.name: P:socket4net.Timer.Expires
member.summary: The expire time. this property only be used by TimerScheduler class.

member.name: P:socket4net.Timer.Entry
member.summary: When timer is started, it's put in queue, this property is the queue entry for this timer object. this property only be used by TimerScheduler class.

member.summary: When timer is trigger, this event will be called.

member.summary: Construct a new entry object with a timer object.

member.summary: Construct a new head entry. That is, it's Prev/Next properties are point to itself.

member.summary: Queue the entry object into a queue specify by 'h'
member.param: the entry object, must be a head entry object

member.name: T:socket4net.TimerConstant
member.summary: Define the constant variable used by TimerScheduler class

member.name: T:socket4net.TVR
member.summary: Timer vector class. It's a specific type of TVN, it's vector size is different from TVN.

member.name: F:socket4net.TimerScheduler._timerJiffies
member.summary: This field used to store how many milliseconds elapsed since this scheduler been constructed. All timer's expire time is calculated base on this field.

member.name: F:socket4net.TimerScheduler._runningTimer
member.summary: When scheduler is trigger a timer, this field store the timer object.

member.name: F:socket4net.TimerScheduler._TV1
member.summary: The first class of timers vector, their expire time will less than 256 milliseconds.

member.name: F:socket4net.TimerScheduler._TV2
member.summary: The second class of timers vector, their expire time will grater than 255 milliseconds and less than 16384(1 left shit 14) milliseconds

member.name: F:socket4net.TimerScheduler._TV3
member.summary: The second class of timers vector, their expire time will grater than 16384 milliseconds and less than 1048576(1 left shit 20) milliseconds

member.name: F:socket4net.TimerScheduler._TV4
member.summary: The second class of timers vector, their expire time will grater than 1048576 milliseconds and less than 67108864(1 left shit 26) milliseconds

member.name: F:socket4net.TimerScheduler._TV5
member.summary: The second class of timers vector, their expire time will grater than 67108864 milliseconds and less than uint.Max(1 left shit 32) milliseconds if the expires is grater then uint.Max, it will be truncated.

member.name: M:socket4net.TimerScheduler.RunTimer
member.summary: StaService's Idle event call this method to check all expired timers.

member.name: M:socket4net.TimerScheduler.Add(socket4net.Timer)
member.summary: Put a timer object in scheduler's queue.

member.name: M:socket4net.TimerScheduler.Remove(socket4net.Timer)
member.summary: remove a timer object from scheduler's queue.

member.name: M:socket4net.TimerScheduler.InternalAdd(socket4net.QueueEntry)
member.summary: Queue an entry object into a suitable timer queue.
